org.timepedia.chronoscope.client
Class Chart

java.lang.Object
  org.timepedia.chronoscope.client.Chart
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.timepedia.exporter.client.Exportable
public class Chart
extends java.lang.Object
implements org.timepedia.exporter.client.Exportable

The Chart class composes a XYPlot and a View. A plot is a platform-independent model of all the components necessary to render a dataset, and a view is a platform specific component (browser canvas, Java2d environment, Flash canvas) that provides the operations necessary for interfacing with the graphics system.

Author:
Ray Cromwell <ray@timepedia.org>

click

public boolean click(int x,
                     int y)
Process a click on the Plot window given the screen space coordinates, returns true if the click succeeded (e.g. it 'hit' something)

A stable ID used to serialize chart state

getPlot

public XYPlot getPlot()
The current plot. This method is likely to change, as the number of plots expand, XYPlot will become a subinterface of a more general 'Plot' interface

The current view used for rendering.

pageLeft

public void pageLeft(double amt)
Animated pan to the left by the designated percentage (0.0, 1.0) of the currently visible domain. For example, 0.5 will move the domain origin by getCurrentDomain() * 0.5

pageRight

public void pageRight(double amt)
Animated pan to the right the designated percentage (0.0, 1.0) of the currently visible domain. For example, 0.5 will move the domain origin by getCurrentDomain() * 0.5

Advance the focused datapoint to the previous point

Animated zoom-out of the currently visible domain by a fixed zoomfactor

redraw

public void redraw()
Redraw will redraw the the chart, swapping front/back buffers if necessary in a double-buffered scenario.

reloadStyles

public void reloadStyles()
Reprocess all style information and reinitialize the plot. useful for style-sheet changing.

scrollPixels

public void scrollPixels(int pixels)
Pan the current domain of the plot by the given number of screen pixels (positive or negative)

setAnimating

public void setAnimating(boolean animating)
When an animation is in progress, a lower resolution view of the dataset is used to speed up framerate

setPlotFocus

public void setPlotFocus(int x,
                         int y)
For multiplots, this will be used to set the focus of keyboard/mouse events actions. For example, if you combine two plots using a future SharedDomainXYPlot class, this method will do hit detection or delegate to a composition class which does it, in order to determine which of the subplots should receive navigation commands

zoomToHighlight

public void zoomToHighlight()
Causes chart to perform an animated zoom such that the current selection becomes the currently visible domain.
